I'm on the fence 'bout 4k. It's pretty and all, but as close as I always am to my monitor, I'm not certain it's worth it. Plus I'd have to upgrade my PC anyway to really be able to push a 4k setup, lol
yeah you pretty much need a 1080 or better to do 4k gaming even at 60fps if you are lucky
Yup. At this point I'm pretty okay sticking with my 1080p res, lol
also, 1080p looks just damn fine on a 40inch LED
so the "necessity" of 4k is lost on me.
I'd like to. Maybe get a copy of Computers for Dummies or something. XD
Eh. I've seen 4k on big TVs. It DOES look damned nice. But having the hardware to push it properly is a bit costly currently.
for my main monitor I have a 2k monitor
i've got a gaming monitor that's 144hz 1080p
that's where i play my games, the 4k is going to be 99.8% webpages, picarto streams, etc =P
I have an old as hell 1080p monitor, and a normal TV! :joy:
But, yeah, I've got a digital designe class next semester...so i'll at least be a bit more competent with art programs
my 2k monitor is also a 144hz - i think theres only 2 4k monitors that really can do 144hz but they are like 1000 dollars
Yeah, I think if anything my next monitor will be more concentrated on a higher hz than rez.
im just saying a lot more 2k monitors are 144hz with little price increase vs just a high end 1080p monitor
Honestly just never even considered 2k. They got lost in the sea of 4k talking.
yeah but 4k has the GPU overhead that makes it near impossible for budget gamers
2k is doable on a 1070 easily- 1060's can do it well too
a lot of people dont realize that 4k isn't as simple as being 4 times 1080 - it's 9 times bigger
so its like trying to run 9 1080 monitors
Tis indeed a lot of pixels
My poor little 970 would just be like "wtf you smokin?" :rofl:
Fairly damned sure that's not how resolutions work, sage. Bigger than 4, sure, cuz QHD is 3840x2160, but 4k is 4096x2160. it's not even remotely close to 9 times.
nine 1080p displays would be 3420x5760 and that's not even the same ratio.
i didnt check my math - kinda busy- however it's important to remember that it is area and not just a flat line
That's the resolution you're looking for. :P
a lot of people just see 3840 vs 1920
cuz it's 3 top and 3 wide, zro
I like my numbers better. 9x in both directions! ^^
so yeah- i should have said people think its closer to double when it's actually 4x
Either way 5760x3240 is what you were looking for. You swapped your directions. That's why your ratio was messed up, lol.
ah i remember where i saw 9x
but 4k and 1080p aren't the same ratio anyway
thats why they call it 4k and not 3840 x 2160
because the 1080 is not the first number its the last number- the lower one
Well it depends. According to what I'm finding 4k refers to either 3840x2160, or 4096x2160. Which is dumb.
4096? They are actually doing real 4k now? XD
i havent seen any of them but i dont look em up all that much
4k is the 4096, but a lot of people refer to 2160p as 4k cuz it's quad 1080p, but it's not full 4k resolution
I've got an article I'm reading here
I can post it if you like sage :U
though its not true- that is what they legit call it
though i think there was a push to call it UHD instead?

that changed rather recently with an official definition for what HDR is now- they cant do that anymore
that said- it is still tricky because they had several versions of HDR
